actions.text: Amendment (A002) in the nature of a substitute offered by Mr. Hutchinson.
On agreeing to the Hutchinson amendment (A002) Failed by recorded vote: 155 - 268 (Roll no. 254).

description: Amendment in the nature of a substitute sought to create general rules relating to civil forfeiture proceedings and require the United States to establish, by a preponderance of the evidence, that the property is subject to forfeiture.
purpose: An amendment no. 25 and printed in the Congressional Record to create general rules relating to civil forfeiture proceedings and require the United States to establish, by a preponderance of the evidence, that the property is subject to forfeiture.
